comments.body: This optimization could be pushed down into `sbt-util`.
... although that repo is now archived so I guess `Zinc` will end up with a copy of a subset of its data structues to avoid a circular dependency. @eed3si9n what's the plan there?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +572,576 @@      externalDependencies,
      classes,
      names = if (names.forwardMap.isEmpty) data else names ++ data,
      productClassName,
    )

comments.body: @gkossakowski binaryClassName here doesn't mean binary as in JAR, but binary as in `*.class` file. We also use the term binary in binaryVersion almost as a pun: two-number and class-file-level.
I see. You're thinking about the sbt. I narrowed my scope to zinc where I think naming is acceptably consistent. In any case, feel free to keep the new name if it helps you navigating the code.
Even within the context of `Relations` alone the `binaryClassName` above is inconsistent with the use of the term binary in `binaryDeps` or "binary dependencies", correct?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +147,151 @@   * This reflects Scala's compiler behavior of generating two class files per top level object declaration.
   */
  def productClassName: Relation[String, String]

  /** The dependency relation between internal classes.*/
